title: ‘Just profiteering’: Trump admin's fresh salvo on India for Russian oil
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent criticized India's Russian oil purchases, deeming it "arbitrage" and accusing them of profiteering by reselling refined products.

title: When 1 MiG beat 4 US fighter jets: IAF jet prepares for touchdown after 6-decade service
content: Air Marshal Prithvi Singh Brar recounts his experiences flying the MiG-21, highlighting its crucial role in the 1971 Indo-Pak War and its significance as a training platform for generations of IAF pilots. Despite its eventual 'flying coffin' tag, Brar remembers the MiG-21 with fondness, emphasizing its reliability and the skills it instilled in pilots.

title: India Asia Cup 2025 squad vs last T20I XI: Key changes, inclusions, and omissions - more inside
content: India announce its 15-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025, retaining Suryakumar Yadav as captain and promoting Shubman Gill to vice-captain. The squad sees the return of Jasprit Bumrah and includes fresh faces like Harshit Rana and Jitesh Sharma. While a strong core from the victorious England series remains, notable omissions include Mohammed Shami, Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal.

title: Population crisis: Musk warns of collapse again; This country forecast to lose 1 mln people by 2025
content: Elon Musk is again warning about declining population. He says Japan will lose nearly a million people soon. Musk believes artificial intelligence can reverse this trend. He has been warning about this since the turn of the century. He also highlights the issue in countries like South Korea and Italy. Musk sees population collapse as a threat to civilization.

title: PM Modi meets Wang Yi - How tariff, border tensions made elephant, dragon tango again
content: Chinese foreign minister Wang Yi met with Prime Minister Modi in New Delhi to discuss easing tensions between India and China. The visit, at the invitation of NSA Ajit Doval, included the 24th round of Special Representatives' Talks on the boundary issue. Discussions also encompassed trade, pilgrimages, and regional developments, preceding Modi's anticipated trip to China for the SCO summit.

title: 'Khada hoon aaj bhi wahin': Nadda mocks Rahul's 'vote chori' claim; shares video
content: BJP president JP Nadda has criticized Rahul Gandhi's "vote chori" claims, sharing a video alleging it's a "scripted PR" stunt. The video features a woman retracting her complaint about missing names from the voter list. Amit Malviya also attacked Rahul after a psephologist admitted to incorrect voter data, demanding an apology for targeting the Election Commission.

title: Into the storm: US Air Force plane flies straight into eye of Hurricane Erin - watch
content: The US Air Force captured dramatic footage flying into Hurricane Erin's eye, revealing a calm center amidst the storm. Erin rapidly intensified from a Category 1 to a Category 5 hurricane, shocking forecasters. While currently far from land, its path is monitored due to potential shifts, with coastal regions urged to stay alert for possible impacts.

title: Apple's big India move: All iPhone 17 models Made in India for US; Trump could be reason why
content: Apple is set to manufacture all iPhone 17 models in India before their September launch, a first for the company, including the Pro versions. This shift, driven by tariff concerns and geopolitical tensions, aims to fulfill most US iPhone demand from India. Tata Group will produce half of India's iPhones, boosting exports which reached $7.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Ajit Agarkar finally reveals why Gill gets vice-captaincy – details inside
content: Ajit Agarkar explained the Asia Cup 2025 squad selection. Shreyas Iyer will miss out due to squad composition. Shubman Gill is the vice-captain, replacing Axar Patel. Gill's performance in England impressed selectors. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the team. Abhishek Sharma's bowling ability secured his place over Yashasvi Jaiswal. The Asia Cup 2025 will start on September 9 in the UAE.

title: What Mumbai rains did to city - 10 videos that show havoc
content: Maharashtra is grappling with severe flooding due to incessant rains, claiming at least six lives and displacing hundreds. Mumbai and other districts are on high alert as the IMD forecasts more intense rainfall. Authorities are evacuating vulnerable areas, with the NDRF and Army assisting in rescue operations. Farmland is submerged, and infrastructure is severely damaged, disrupting connectivity across the state.

title: ‘Rockets to Wall Street’: Musk’s teen prodigy leaves SpaceX; joins Citadel Securities
content: Kairan Quazi, the 16-year-old prodigy who previously worked at SpaceX, is now joining Citadel Securities as a developer in New York City. He chose the quantitative trading firm over AI labs and big tech companies, drawn to the fast-paced environment and intellectual challenges. Quazi will be working on global trading infrastructure, embracing Wall Street's meritocratic culture.

title: Russia sets major rider for 'long-term peace' deal, day after Zelenskyy-Trump meet
content: Russia stated firmly that any lasting peace agreement with Ukraine must address the security concerns of Russia and the rights of Russian-speaking people in Ukraine. This declaration followed discussions between Zelenskyy and Trump, where Trump indicated he would consult with Putin after their meeting.

title: Asia Cup 2025: No Rishabh Pant in India’s squad - Here is why
content: Rishabh Pant's fractured foot rules him out of the Asia Cup 2025, solidifying Sanju Samson's position as the primary wicketkeeper. Jitesh Sharma has been included as the second option. Pant's recent struggles, including a poor IPL season, further impacted his chances. The final decision on the wicketkeeper will depend on the team's batting strategy.

title: 'Next 48 hours crucial': Maha CM sounds alert; rescue personnel gear up as toll rises to 8
content: Mumbai was brought to a standstill due to torrential rainfall, causing widespread flooding and disrupting transportation networks. The heavy downpour, which accounted for a significant portion of the city's monthly average, led to submerged areas, railway track inundation, and flight disruptions.

title: India Women’s ODI WC 2025 squad:No place for Shafali Verma - here’s why
content: Shafali Verma's recent poor form led to her exclusion from India's 15-member squad for the upcoming Women's World Cup, as announced by selectors. Harmanpreet Kaur will captain the team, aiming for their first World Cup title. Medium-pace bowler Renuka Thakur returns after injury, and India will prepare with ODIs against Australia.

title: 'India will be ...': What BJP said on impact of Trump's tariff; cites local consumption
content: The BJP downplayed the impact of US tariffs on India, emphasizing the nation's strong domestic consumption, contributing significantly to its GDP. Syed Zafar Islam highlighted India's resilience amidst global economic challenges, contrasting it with higher inflation rates in the US and UK. He credited PM Modi's policies for strengthening India's economy, citing positive outlooks from international rating agencies.

title: 'Ghuspaithiya Bachao Yatra': BJP targets Rahul's 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' after Psephologist's apology
content: BJP has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi for his "vote theft" allegations, following Sanjay Kumar's admission of incorrect voter data related to Maharashtra elections. BJP accuses Gandhi of using false figures to push a narrative against the Election Commission. Malviya demands an apology from Rahul, calling his yatra a scheme to protect infiltrators after Kumar apologized for the misleading claims.

title: Opted for new income tax regime? Don’t stop putting money in these investments
content: While the new income tax regime eliminates many deductions, some tax-saving investments remain crucial. PPF's tax-free returns and term insurance's risk coverage are still valuable. Health insurance protects against medical inflation, and employer-linked NPS contributions offer tax benefits. However, ELSS should be replaced with diversified equity funds, and traditional insurance policies should be re-evaluated.

title: Toronto Maple Leafs’ Matthew Knies attends Grant Cruikshank and McKenna’s wedding in Wisconsin
content: Toronto Maple Leafs forward Matthew Knies joined the celebration of his former Minnesota Gophers teammate, Grant Cruikshank, who married McKenna in Wisconsin. The wedding added to a memorable offseason for Knies, who has balanced time with family and friends while preparing for the upcoming NHL season. His presence highlighted the strong ties formed during his college hockey career.

title: With Pakistan out over security: Hockey Asia Cup 2025 in India from Aug 29; full schedule
content: India are set to clash with China in their opening match of the Hockey Asia Cup 2025, scheduled for August 29 in Rajgir, Bihar. The tournament not only crowns Asia's top team but also offers a coveted qualification spot for the FIH Hockey World Cup Belgium-Netherlands 2026. Eight teams will compete, with the final slated for September 7.

title: Vote Adhikar Yatra: Rahul Gandhi’s convoy 'crushes' cop - watch
content: The BJP has strongly criticized Congress leader Rahul Gandhi after a video surfaced allegedly showing his car running over a police constable during the 'Vote Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar. BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla shared the video, claiming the officer was critically injured and Gandhi did not stop to check on him.

title: Asia Cup: Shubman Gill is breathing down Suryakumar Yadav's neck
content: Shubman Gill's elevation to India's T20I vice-captain is a clear sign that he might end up leading the team instead of Suryakumar Yadav in the T20I World Cup at home. There are still seven months to go to the marquee event, and in Indian cricket, things can change in seven hours.

title: Airline-style baggage charges in trains? Railways to implement new strict luggage rules
content: Indian Railways is implementing stricter baggage rules, including weight checks at major stations like Prayagraj Junction, mirroring airline practices. Passengers exceeding weight limits will face extra charges, with allowances varying by travel class.

title: 'Will make Rahul PM': Tejashwi Yadav vows 2029 support; calls NDA govt in Bihar 'khatara'
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav appealed to Bihar voters. He wants them to support Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for Prime Minister in 2029. Yadav aims to defeat the National Democratic Alliance in the upcoming state elections. He criticized Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's government. Yadav accused the Bharatiya Janata Party of voter disenfranchisement.

title: No thanks: How Zelenskyy snubbed Trump by not suiting up
content: But Zelenskyy has spent the last three years rewriting that script. His wartime wardrobe is not an accident of comfort but a deliberate symbol. Sweatshirts, fatigues, and henleys have become part of Ukraine’s frontline diplomacy, reminding the world at every summit that Kyiv is not hosting cocktail parties but fighting for survival.

title: Asia Cup 2025: India selectors continue to be unfair on Shreyas Iyer; one squad sheet at a time!
content: Indian cricket must keep the door open for Shreyas Iyer in white-ball formats, especially with the T20 World Cup at home next year. Though his inclusion at No. 3 adds more right-handers than Gautam Gambhir might prefer, Iyer’s ability to anchor innings and adapt makes him indispensable. His presence balances flair with stability, making him a strong contender for a starting spot.

title: 'We finally feel accepted’: Gujarat village ends Dalit haircut ban
content: In a village in Banaskantha, a Dalit man received a haircut at a local barber shop for the first time, marking the end of a decades-long discriminatory practice. This change came after persistent efforts from the Dalit community, local activists, and intervention from the district administration.

title: Stuart Skinner’s wife Chloe shares holiday photos; son Beau holds snake—see pics
content: Edmonton Oilers goalie Stuart Skinner balanced family time and professional dedication this offseason. His wife, Chloe, shared vacation photos, including one of their son Beau posing with a snake. Despite recent Stanley Cup Final losses, Skinner is determined to improve and lead the Oilers, alongside stars Connor McDavid and Leon Draisaitl, in their quest to end a long championship drought.

title: ‘We are alive’: Elderly MP couple kneel before minister as records show them ‘dead’
content: An elderly couple in Madhya Pradesh's Panna district, declared 'dead' in panchayat records, pleaded with a state minister for justice after their land was allegedly seized. The district collector has ordered an inquiry, revealing the couple had migrated decades ago and their land was sold by their son, who is now deceased.

title: Asia Cup 2025: 5 shocking omissions from India’s squad - Shreyas Iyer, Yashasvi Jaiswal miss out
content: Suryakumar Yadav and Ajit Agarkar revealed the Asia Cup squad. Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal were surprisingly left out. Washington Sundar and Mohammed Siraj also missed the cut. The squad includes Suryakumar Yadav as captain and Shubman Gill as vice-captain. The Asia Cup will be held in Dubai and Abu Dhabi.

title: Tower Ride' collapses from height of 50 feet in Gujarat
content: A major accident at a fair in Bilimora, Navsari, injured five people, including two children, when a 'Tower Ride' collapsed from 50 feet. The incident occurred amidst large crowds gathered near Somnath Temple. Police are investigating possible negligence, while a committee probes procedural lapses. The accident has raised concerns about public safety at Gujarat fairs, reminiscent of past tragedies.

title: Sunjay Kapur’s sister alleges Sachdev forced mother to sign papers amid feud
content: Following Sunjay Kapur's death, a family feud has erupted over his substantial estate. His sister, Mandhira, alleges that their mother was coerced into signing documents by Sunjay's widow, Priya Sachdev, and others during the mourning period.

title: Maharashtra rain havoc continues: Toll rises to 8, hundreds evacuated
content: Heavy rainfall continues to batter Maharashtra, resulting in eight deaths in the past two days, including a 75-year-old woman killed in a Raigad landslide. With Mumbai and other districts on high alert, authorities are evacuating residents and deploying rescue teams. The IMD forecasts continued intense rainfall, while agricultural land and villages face inundation.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Who will open the batting? Ajit Agarkar clears the air
content: Suryakumar Yadav leads India in the Asia Cup 2025, with Shubman Gill as his deputy. The squad announcement sparked debate, especially regarding the opening combination of Abhishek Sharma with either Gill or Sanju Samson. India aims to balance power and stability in their top order as they face Pakistan, UAE, and Oman in Group A, beginning September 10 in Dubai.

title: 'Vote chori' row: Posters urge Anna Hazare to ‘wake up’; activist calls incident ‘unfortunate’
content: Posters have surfaced in Pune, urging Anna Hazare to address alleged 'vote theft,' prompting the veteran activist to express sadness over being questioned. Hazare emphasized his past contributions in enacting anti-corruption laws and encouraged the younger generation to take the lead.

title: ‘The dead don’t talk’: Fingerprints cracked Sohna mystery; revenge plot trail exposed
content: Gurgaon police solved a perplexing murder case in Sohna, where a man was found dead with his throat slit. The victim was identified as Sameer, an accused in a Pocso case from Rishikesh, through fingerprint analysis and a tattoo. Investigations revealed that Sameer was murdered by the girl's brother, Sonu, and his accomplices as revenge for eloping with his sister.

title: Lok Sabha goes multilingual: Interpretation available in all 22 scheduled languages
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla announced the availability of simultaneous interpretation in all 22 languages listed in the Eighth Schedule of the Constitution, completing the list with the addition of Kashmiri, Konkani, and Santhali. This advancement ensures smoother communication, reflecting India's linguistic diversity in parliamentary proceedings. BJP MP Dr.

title: Doval meets China's Wang Yi: NSA praises 'upward trend' on India-China ties
content: NSA Ajit Doval met with Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi, highlighting the positive impact of the Modi-Xi meeting in Kazan on bilateral relations. Doval noted improved border conditions and increased engagement. Jaishankar emphasized the importance of maintaining peace at the border and preventing differences from escalating into disputes during his meeting with Wang Yi.

title: 'Tomorrow not promised': SUV crashes into YouTubers mid-meal – watch
content: YouTubers NinaUnrated and Patrick Blackwood experienced a terrifying incident while filming a food review at Piada Italian Street Food in Tyler, Texas. An SUV crashed through the restaurant's glass wall, hitting the pair and causing minor injuries. Blackwood, who was sitting next to the window, sustained cuts from the shattered glass, but both reviewers expressed gratitude for surviving the unexpected event.

title: Barnwell picks five NFL teams set to decline: Who could miss the playoffs entirely?
content: Which teams will take a step back and lose more games this season? We made five picks based on troubling signs, offseason subtractions and more.

title: Sources: Colts tab Jones as Week 1 starting QB
content: The Colts have named Daniel Jones as their Week 1 starting QB, sources told ESPN, opting for the veteran over Anthony Richardson Sr.

title: Sources: Sun eye options to salvage record sale
content: Connecticut Sun ownership intends to present multiple options to the WNBA as it looks to salvage what would have been a record-breaking $325 million franchise sale, sources told ESPN.

title: Hendrickson not budging in standoff with Bengals
content: Bengals defensive end Trey Hendrickson remains entrenched in his position on not playing in the upcoming season.

title: Commanders' Robinson sits out amid uncertainty
content: Washington Commanders veteran running back Brian Robinson Jr. did not play in his club's 31-17 preseason loss to the Cincinnati Bengals on Monday night in Landover, Maryland, possibly signaling the end of his tenure with the franchise after three seasons.

title: Klubnik on Dabo support: Others said 'I sucked'
content: Cade Klubnik said he appreciates the support he has received from Dabo Swinney, who backed the QB when "a lot of people wanted me out of Clemson."

title: Trump National Doral back on '26 PGA Tour slate
content: Trump National Doral will return to PGA Tour schedule next year as a signature event -- the Miami Championship, the tour announced Tuesday.

title: Titans QB Ward scuffles with DT Simmons in camp
content: Titans rookie QB Cam Ward got into a scuffle with defensive lineman Jeffrey Simmons as the two exchanged shoves.

title: D-backs star Marte apologizes, explains absence
content: Ketel Marte explained he was "frustrated" and "in a bad spot" after his home was burglarized during the All-Star break, leading him to miss games.

title: 🏈 Fantasy football: Our brand new mock draft
content: Peak draft season is almost here. Our crew provides a good practice run through a 12-teamer to help you prepare for the real thing.

title: What to believe -- and not to believe in the National League
content: Milwaukee is on fire. New York is ice cold. Top players are hurt or struggling. Here's what it all means.

title: What makes Tarik Skubal and Paul Skenes the best pitchers on the planet
content: Here's what separates the Cy Young favorites from other aces, according to those who watch them most.

title: Meet the Bama-beating, NCAA-suing QB ready to take Vanderbilt to the next level
content: Never one to back down, Diego Pavia has made a name for himself in Nashville -- and he's not done yet.

title: Cam Ward, Brian Callahan and the Tennessee Titans' historically worrying challenge
content: The past two No. 1 picks have seen their coaches fired in November. How will Cam Ward (and Brian Callahan) avoid the same fate?

title: Bring back the bison: How an on-campus movement resurrected Indiana's mascot after 50 years
content: Indiana's original bison mascot was described as "the devil with a cheerleader in it" -- but now a new version has risen from the ashes thanks to a passionate professor, underground student government action, a campus bar and more.

title: NBA milestones: Landmarks to watch this season for LeBron, Jokic and others
content: Important milestones to watch ahead of the 2025-26 season, including another historic season from LeBron James and Nikola Jokic.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Should the Dream be considered title contenders?
content: Atlanta will be pressure-tested against the league's best teams this week, starting with a red-hot Las Vegas.

title: 'We know how to weather storms': How the Aces saved their season
content: Las Vegas, .500 at the All-Star break, has won seven straight and is vying to host early WNBA playoff games.

title: Aging stars coming to MLS from Europe: How do you know when it'll be a hit or a bust?
content: From Lionel Messi to Son Heung-Min, how do MLS teams know when signing a close-to-retirement star from Europe is a good idea?

title: What early issues need solving for some top Premier League clubs?
content: The first matchday of the Premier League is over, so what did some of the top clubs learn from it? Arsenal need to fix their press, while Chelsea could play Cole Palmer out wide.

title: What Browns naming Joe Flacco QB1 means for Shedeur Sanders, Dillon Gabriel
content: The Browns have a Week 1 starter, but the clock to begin finding their long-term quarterback solution continues.

title: AFC East betting preview: Bills odds-on favorite to take division
content: Can anyone keep up with the Bills in the AFC East? Here are all the odds for each team in the division and our favorite bets.

title: A quest to understand the Carlos Alcaraz/Emma Raducanu ship
content: Carlos Alcaraz and Emma Raducanu say they're just friends. But a growing group of their fans is rooting for far more than just a US Open mixed doubles title. Welcome to the world of tennis shippers.

title: Answering the biggest questions facing Keegan Bradley with six U.S. Ryder Cup spots left
content: Will Bradley choose himself to play at ? Who are locks to make the team? We answer some of the biggest questions with six captain's picks left to fill out the team.

title: 'You felt the momentum change': Michael Vick's early impact at Norfolk State
content: Vick is coaching just 30 miles from where he grew up, and in the state where he electrified college football as a player.

title: Solak: Everything I learned at 10 different NFL training camp stops
content: After visits with 10 NFL teams in eight states, Ben Solak compiled the best things he heard -- and saw -- throughout the trip.

title: NWSL Power Rankings: San Diego becomes KC's closest challenger
content: Kansas City is all alone out front, but the fight for second? That's headed by San Diego in ESPN's latest NWSL Power Rankings.

title: How will Xabi Alonso handle LaLiga refereeing at Real Madrid?
content: As Real Madrid's new manager, Alonso will soon be exposed to the eccentricities of refereeing in LaLiga.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United eye Lammens, as Inter chase Onana
content: Manchester United could look to Antwerp goalkeeper Senne Lammens as Inter Milan consider a reunion with André Onana. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Moses Itauma makes massive impression at heavyweight
content: Itauma's quick finish of Dillian Whyte on Saturday elevates him in top 10. Here are the latest ESPN rankings in all weight classes.

title: Mumbai Monorail Breaks Down Amid Heavy Rain, Nearly 100 Passengers Inside
content: A monorail broke down in Mumbai this evening amid heavy rain, stranding nearly 100 passengers for more than an hour.

title: Mumbai Rain News Live Updates: Monorail Breaks Down, Red Alert Till Wednesday
content: Mumbai Rains LIVE News: Heavy rainfall led to waterlogging on roads, and delayed flights and trains, with a red alert in place till Wednesday.

title: INDIA's Veep Pick Best Known For "Weakening Fight Against Naxalism": BJP Sources
content: Hitting out at the Congress and the INDIA bloc for picking B Sudershan Reddy as their nominee for the vice president polls, government sources have said the former Supreme Court judge is best remembered for "weakening India's fight against Naxalism".

title: "Will Work To Make Rahul Gandhi Next PM": Tejashwi Yadav
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday made a strong pitch in support of his 'bade bhai (elder brother)' and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, during the ongoing Voter Adhikar Yatra.

title: Explained: Why North India, Pakistan Are Being Hit So Badly by Cloudbursts
content: Massive, sudden downpours of rain known as cloudbursts have struck India and Pakistan during this monsoon season, killing hundreds of people in the flash floods and landslides they have triggered.

title: Axiom Chief Scientist Praises "Wonderful Job" By Shubhanshu Shukla In Space
content: In a historic leap for India's human spaceflight ambitions, Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, whose call sign is "Shux," completed an 18-day journey aboard the International Space Station (ISS) as part of the Axiom 4 mission.

title: 3 Killed In Fire At Illegal Oil Well In Indonesia
content: Firefighters in Indonesia are struggling to contain a three-day-old fire at an illegal oil well that has killed at least three people and injured two others, a disaster relief official said on Tuesday.

title: Ukraine Allies Meet With Hopes Of Peace Talks Breakthrough
content: Ukraine's allies were meeting on Tuesday to discuss the outcome of fast-moving talks to end the war with Russia, after indications that Volodymyr Zelensky could sit down with Vladimir Putin for a peace summit.

title: Man, 21, Gets 14-Week Jail For Racist Death Threat Emails To Rishi Sunak
content: A 21-year-old man has been sentenced to 14 weeks' imprisonment and a two-year restraining order for sending racist death threats to Rishi Sunak in June last year, when he was still the British prime minister.

title: "Saw Them Putting Papa's Body In Drum": Son Of Man Killed By Wife, Lover
content: Days after a man's rotting body was found in a blue drum in Rajasthan's Alwar, his 8-year-old son has emerged as a crucial witness to the case in which his mother and her alleged lover are the prime accused.

title: All About Online Gaming Bill, Cleared By Union Cabinet
content: The Online Gaming Bill seeks to regulate online gaming in India and make betting via digital platforms a punishable offence.

title: "Sure, I'll Meet Zelensky": Putin Ready For Direct Russia-Ukraine Talks, Rubio Confirms
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said that Russian President Vladimir Putin told his US counterpart Donald Trump that he was willing to meet Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: Bill To Regulate Online Gaming Gets Cabinet Nod, Next Stop Lok Sabha
content: A bill to regulate online gaming has been cleared by the union cabinet, and is likely to be introduced in the Lok Sabha tomorrow, sources said.

title: 358, Including 30 Children, Killed In Pakistan Due To Flash Floods
content: Rescue workers on Tuesday recovered more bodies from a mountain village in northwest Pakistan where flash floods triggered by a cloudburst brought down homes and buildings, bringing the death count there to at least 20.

title: Rahul Gandhi's Car Hits Cop During Bihar Yatra, BJP's "Crush Janta" Jibe
content: A policeman was injured during a freak incident involving a car carrying the Leader of Opposition, Rahul Gandhi, during the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar this morning.

title: Woman Watches Web Series On Crimes, Studies Murder Cases Before Killing Husband
content: Fed up of being subjected to physical assault and suspicion, a woman and her friends in Jaipur murdered her husband on Saturday.

title: Man Poisons Wife, Buries Her Body In Graveyard In Delhi, Arrested: Cops
content: A man, along with his three associates, killed his wife by administering sleeping pills laced with poison over suspicion of infidelity and buried the body in a graveyard in South Delhi, police said on Tuesday.

title: Air Canada Flight Attendants End Strike After Reaching 'Tentative' Deal
content: The union representing Air Canada flight attendants said on Tuesday it had ended a strike over wages and unpaid ground work after reaching a "tentative agreement" with the airline.

title: 'Finding 70 Missing In Kishtwar Cloudburst Alive Next To Impossible': Omar Abdullah
content: Five days after a cloudburst hit the Machail Mata yatra base camp in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district, killing at least 64 people, Chief Minister Omar Abdullah has said finding the 70 missing people alive is next to impossible.

title: GBG Act 2024 better than BBMP Act 2020 but falls short, says Janaagraha
content: The draft of the GBG Bill, 2024, submitted by the Brand Bengaluru Committee scores 6.8, double that of the GBG Act brought in by the State government

title: Kerala to be declared fully digitally literate on Aug. 21
content: Minister for Local-Self Governments M.B. Rajesh says with the government making available most of its services online through the KSMART platform, it also aims to equip the entire population with the necessary digital skills to access these

title: Singareni becomes first coal PSU to take up exploration of gold, copper in country
content: CMD N. Balaram says it’s a “golden step” into exploration of critical minerals as the company wins bid to survey the metals in Devadurga, Karnataka

title: Employment orders to be issued to 402 newly chosen SIs in 15-20 days
content: There was a dire shortage of SIs in the Home Department, and the government was keen to issue the employment order at the earliest: Home Minister

title: 95% conviction rate in prohibition offences since July 2024, say Tamil Nadu police
content:
After hooch tragedies claimed over 90 lives in Kallakurichi, 
Villuppuram, and Chengalpet districts, special teams were formed to expedite the trial in pending cases as part of a strategy to curb the brewing, transport, and sale of spurious liquor in 10 northern districts

title: Lok Sabha passes Bill to set up IIM in Guwahati
content: This fulfils a long-standing demand in Assam, and provides the northeast with its second IIM after Shillong, says Education Minister; financial grant of ₹550 crore has been allocated for IIM Guwahati

title: NGO urges State to issue special health card for children with long-term illness
content: Thrissur-based NGO Solace, which supports over 7,000 critically ill children, appeals to the Chief Minister for urgent government action

title: Congress holds sticker campaign against ‘Vote Theft’ in Mysuru
content: KPCC spokesperson Lakshman alleges that BJP won the Lok Sabha elections of 2014, 2019, and 2024 through ‘vote theft’

title: Karnataka Assembly session: Bill passed to regularise illegal buildings by levying penalty
content: Minister said building plan violations eligible for regulation is being raised from 5% to 15% and the Bill would allow regularising buildings on 20x30 ft. and 30x40 ft. sites

title: Ahead of Onam, 17,000 litres of spurious, sub-standard coconut oil seized in inspections
content: Legal measures initiated against coconut oil manufacturers selling fake brands, with fake FSSAI licences

title: No change in Taiwan policy, say government sources after Beijing’s claim
content: After a Chinese Foreign Ministry statement said, “Stable, cooperative, and forward-looking India-China relations serve the interests of both countries. Taiwan is part of China”, the government sources said India has economic, technology and cultural ties with Taiwan that will continue

title: Plea by KTU V-C: Kerala HC declines to issue order
content: K. Sivaprasad approached the court seeking a directive to resolve the alleged administrative stalemate at the university

title: Why there are no Tibetan terrorists: a refugee poet’s lessons on love and exile
content: Tenzin Tsundue, Tibetan-origin poet and activist, explains how compassion, not anger, shapes a community that has suffered death, displacement, and destruction

title: Kodagu police nab accused in theft case after a two-month-long chase; Footage from 500 CCTV cameras checked during pursuit
content: The accused struck a police quarters at Madikeri, broke into eight houses, and decamped with ₹95,000 and 5.5 gm of gold valuables; police took up the investigation as a ‘prestige issue’

title: Eight dead, crops on 14 Lakh acres damaged as rains pound Maharashtra for the second day
content: 350 mm rain in 24 hours, local train services disrupted in Mumbai, 350 evacuated as Mithi reaches danger mark for a few hours

title: B.K. Hariprasad seeks Council resolution condemning ECI’s actions
content: He urged the Council to pass a resolution condemning the ECI’s actions, alleging misuse of EVM technology and manipulation of voter lists

title: Mysugar fund misuse to be probed, says Minister Patil
content: The sugar recovery rate, which was barely 3.5% earlier, has now increased to 8%. The co-generation power plant too was commissioned only after our government came to power: Shivananda Patil, Minister for Sugar

title: Rain continues to batter North Karnataka districts
content: As many as 101 residents relocated in Uttara Kannada, even as incessant rain causes damage to houses, crops, severs road connectivity elsewhere

title: Facing opposition fire, Election Commission of India says took 28 initiatives to strengthen electoral system
content: The ECI said linking death-registration data will ensure that the field poll machinery receives timely information about registered deaths

title: After getting a statue, Eldho now to be honoured with a commemorative meeting
content: Local people erected a statue of Eldho, a beloved stray dog from  Eroor North, after it passed away recently. They feel the least Eldho deserved was a statue  after being an integral part of the community for nearly a decade-and-a-half

title: Karnataka Assembly passes gig workers’ Bill; proposes 1%-5% fee on online aggregators
content: At present, there are four lakh gig workers, including part and full-timers, in State; Bill proposes a welfare fee in the range of 1% to 5% on the payout to the worker during each transaction

title: Black panther cub spotted in Bhadra Tiger Reserve
content: ‘An adult black panther has been spotted earlier. Now the cub is a new entry. We are ensuring the territory of the family is not disturbed.’

title: Presidential Reference Bench says Supreme Court stepped in to resolve an ‘egregious situation’ in Tamil Nadu Governor case
content: Justice P.S. Narasimha said the facts of the Tamil Nadu case did not consist of any “pudding” and were stark in themselves.

title: BJP leader Vijay Goel files complaint against 'dog lovers' for hindering Supreme Court order implementation
content: A FIR was registered at the K.N. Katju Police Station based on the complaint filed by a veterinary officer of the city body

title: KPCC president holds meeting at Kottayam DCC, reviews preparations for local body elections
content: Extensive meetings at the constituency committee level are scheduled from August 22 to 24, followed by ward leadership meetings on August 25, 26, and 27.

title: Here to give an opinion, not overrule Tamil Nadu Governor case judgment: Presidential Reference Bench
content: The Reference was issued merely a month after the Supreme Court, in a case filed by the State of Tamil Nadu against its Governor

title: Students’ body welcomes Minister’s statement on schools
content: 50 lakh signature campaign was launched against the govt.’s earlier decision to close or merge govt. schools with low admissions

title: BJP leaders, devotees and seers participate in pro-Dharmasthala protest in Belagavi
content: State government urged to take legal action against those who are spreading misinformation about Hindu holy place

title: Karnataka Assembly session: BJP questions benefits of Greater Bengaluru Authority; Bill passed
content: Opposition MLAs term the Bill ‘undemocratic and against the spirit of the decentralisation of powers to urban local bodies’

title: Stop crying foul over Amaravati, Andhra Pradesh Municipal Administration Minister Narayana tells YSRCP leaders
content: Advising them to desist from spreading false propaganda that Amaravati has been submerged, Narayana directs the officials to clear the soil deposits causing stagnation of rainwater

title: JSS AHER hosts workshop on digital health strategies
content: The workshop is aimed at exploring the digital healthcare ecosystem and the challenges faced by citizens, healthcare providers, and governments in implementing ABDM and Ayushman Bharat Arogya Karnataka

title: Videos of expunged proceedings should not be shared on social media: Rajya Sabha Chair
content: Radha Mohan Das Agrawal of the BJP raised the issue of the Leader of Opposition Mallikarjun Kharge sharing videos of his expunged speech on social media

title: CPI(M) State secretary sues businessperson, giving legal dimension to leaked letter row
content: In the libel notice, M.V. Govindan’s counsel terms Muhammed Shershad’s allegations as “false, baseless and wanton”.

title: Fact-finding committee on social media posts soon, says Andhra Pradesh Home Minister Anitha
content: The committee will inquire into the derogatory posts against women and initiate stern action against the accused, she says, and also denounces the false propaganda, allegedly by the YSRCP and its friendly media outlets, on capital Amaravati

title: Godavari floodwater surges, officials ready for evacuation
content: Flood threat cuts off Konaseema lanka villages; boats, revenue and police personnel readied for evacuation should inflows at Sir Arthur Cotton Barrage touch 10 lakh cusecs

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Mysuru: Farmers seek ₹4,500 a tonne for sugarcane
content: The Centre has fixed FRP at ₹3,550 a tonne for the current year; protesters demand that the State announce an additional State Advised Price and ensure payment at ₹4,500 a tonne

title: NDRF 10th Battalion deploys teams to tackle rain, floods situation
content: NDRF 10th Battalion Commandant says we have 18 teams at our headquarters in Krishna district. To be prepared for any emergency during monsoon, four more teams from Punjab have also been deployed

title: Selective coverage in rubber replanting scheme sparks farmer backlash
content: KERA Project offers a replanting subsidy of ₹75,000 in two phases.  Eligibility is restricted to growers in Malappuram and Kannur in the north and Ernakulam, Kottayam, Pathanamthitta and Thiruvananthapuram in the south. Idukki, Kollam, and Thrissur have been left out,  prompting discontent among farmers

title: Bilateral agreements with other mineral rich countries already done to offset crisis of rare earth minerals: Minister
content: MoS Jitin Prasada was responding to a set of questions in the Lok Sabha by Hyderabad parliamentarian Asaduddin Owaisi who sought to know whether the electric vehicle industry was impacted by China’s restrictions

title: MMA divisional rankings: Can any middleweight stop Khamzat Chimaev from taking top position?

title: Draft Guide: Rankings, mock drafts and analysis
content: this draft guide will serve as one-stop shop for all of our best fantasy football picks possible in every draft you're in . we have everything needed to help you draft a great team and start the season with a shot . it doesn't matter whether you have been doing this for years or are a first-timer .

title: The stat that could swing every team's 2025-26 season
content: the new national TV calendar is taking shape . the new season schedule was unveiled this past week . training camps open in just over a month . there are plenty of reasons for the Hawks optimism this season . click here for all the latest NBA news .

title: The little-known FIFA rule that gives Alexander Isak all the leverage over Newcastle
content: shaka Hislop thinks Alexander Isak may never be welcomed back into the side . the striker has been holding out after his club turned down a £110 million transfer bid from Liverpool . he is under pressure to force a move out of the club .

title: Field's favorites: Jaylen Waddle, TreVeyon Henderson among popular draft targets
content: ESPN fantasy football's ultimate champ has a lot of mock drafts and real drafts . the column is not a reflection of the best players in fantasy football . it's not an reflection of players no one is talking about . if you're a fantasy football fan, you can be a fan of the game .

title: NFC East betting preview: Can anyone overtake the Eagles?
content: no team has won the NFC East in back-to-back seasons since 2001-04 . the Dallas Cowboys are the third choice at +700, followed by the New York Giants . defending champions are -160 to do just that, with the Washington Commanders next in line at +225 .

title: Everything to know about the revamped -- and controversial -- US Open mixed doubles
content: the mixed doubles event runs concurrently with the main draw and the championship match is held during the final weekend . but this edition will be condensed into two days during qualifying week . the tournament also features an unprecedented number of top-ranked singles players .

title: Preseason Power Rankings: What to expect from each top-25 team
content: in just four days, the college football season kicks off with a week 0 matchup between no. 22 Iowa State and no. 17 Kansas State in Dublin . a lot of change has occurred since January . three of the top five teams in our initial power rankings have new starting quarterbacks .

title: It’s finally time! Where is your team in our preseason Power Rankings?
content: the 2025 season is just around the corner, so it's time to reevaluate the outlooks for all 32 teams . our power panel of more than 30 writers and editors evaluate how NFL teams stack up against each other . check out how holdouts, breakouts and injuries have impacted our rankings .
